title: Disabled husky who used wheelchair found dead days after being snatched by thief
text:
Zorra the disabled husky has been found dead three days after she was stolen along with her owner’s Volvo station wagon. The news was broken by an animal rescue volunteer on Facebook, right (Pictures: Facebook)

A disabled husky dog who used a bright pink wheelchair to walk has been found dead days after being snatched by a thief.

Zorra the white husky’s corpse was recovered Monday, three days after the Volvo she was in was stolen by a thief in Oakland Park, Florida.

Owner Wanda Ferrari was seen being given the heartbreaking news at a rescue center, although investigators have not yet said whether Zorra was killed or died of natural causes.

A Facebook Live video shared by local rescue page 100+ Abandoned Dogs of Florida captured the aftermath of the sad announcement.

A female volunteer with the charity said: ‘It’s not good news.

Zorra vanished after a car thief stole her owner Wanda Ferrari’s Volvo, similar to this model (File photo)

‘They won’t tell us anything other than the fact that Zorra is deceased.

‘They won’t tell us anything. They wont let us see Zorra.

‘They’re just telling us that its an ongoing investigation, and Zorra is gone. She is dead.

‘And I hope that they find this piece of shit and he pays for what he did.’

Jamie Katz, a private investigator tasked with finding out what happened to Zorra said: ‘We have not been given any other information by police except the car was found and Zorra has passed.

‘We are horrified at this news, we can’t imagine what this poor baby went through,.

‘We hope the person responsible for this will be found and justice served.’

A $3,000 reward has been offered to help track down Zorra’s abductor.
description: Zorra, who used a special mobility aid to get around, was found dead three days after she and her owner Wanda Ferrari's car were both stolen
